Decsmber 21{ 1955
Dr. John R. Kirk
4341 S. Oakenwald
Chicago 15, Illihois
Dear Dr. Kirk:
It always strikes me as a groping action to answer a letter received
some eighteen months ago, and not sent to me in the first place. But
•your letter of Lay 28, 1S54 came to me, in copy, shortly after you wrote
it. I made some comments on your series and heard no more about it.
This is an effort to revive your interest, which I believe must have
flagged considerably by this time. At the time, I was a member of tho
Network Planning Committee; at present, I am Chairman of it. and can
assure you that any effort you make will lead to a definite decision
and very shortly.
I was and still am very favorably impressed by the 13 units you
propose. I discussed the entire series as much as possible with tho
brief notes I had with the committee on December 3, The reaction was
quite good and I was authorized to write you. w© would like to have a
sample tape'of one ©f the programs as soon as you can provide one! If
you will send it directly to me, I will see that other members of the
committee and the Committee on Acceptance hear it without delay.
I personally hope very much that you have not lost interest in doing
the series for us or become otherwise engaged to the exclusion of time
fo^ such a project. We all understand how likely such things are after
this lapse of time, but I want to make an attempt to work out the project
with you. I hope to hear from you soon.
Sincerely,
Kenneth D. 'right
Chairman, Sub-Committee on
Radio Program Planning
